result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by phone for Desean Jayden Tyler.  Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler not in court, in custody.   Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Desean Jayden Tyler.  Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No response from defendant/surety.  sb

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. 
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4. 
Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in Court with Attorney Alexander J. Kostal on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in custody. John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Return on Warrant. Discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard regarding bail. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing, Branch 4. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm in Room 629 of the Courthouse.
Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on *Original (Copy) bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for  Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 46. Branch 4 down, Branch 46 will hear. Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($5,000.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 5000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler not in court.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. C
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (15 pages) commencing 04-25-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Stephanie Krueger on behalf of Ian Vance Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.  Case set for an Arraignment. Original information e-file; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, and requests case set for scheduling. Case adjourned, Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Branch 4 down. Parties contacted to advise case has been spun to Judge Shelton Br. 40 at 1:30 pm. Parties notified.

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pursuant to Order signed.   Court admonished defendant to cooperate with Justice Point, make all scheduled office appointments and make him available for all court dates.  Defense request an adjournment on the Arraignment for reasons stated on the record.  The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 4.
  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer  Domagalski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment as well as to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant fails to appear. Case in court for justice point discharge. Atty Sargent is covering counsel for the PD's office (F2). Defense requests stayed warrant until prelim hearing. State requesting bench warrant.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail. Case remains set for prelim in prelim court.
Bail/bond hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

22RM016795  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
3/24/2022

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No driving without a valid license.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Toni T.; and Don S.

Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Desean Jayden Tyler in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Desean Jayden Tyler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
